Jivanmukta derived from the Sanskrit words 'Jiva' (soul) and 'Mukti' (liberation) Just like the body changes clothes everyday, the soul takes new bodies every birth. The divine aspect of the soul is in its immortality, timelessness, self-knowledge as well as the ability to experience itself, both as dual and non-dual. Spirituality is not something that needs to be pursued only when we get ?old? or we having nothing 'better' to do. It is the only way of life. 


Tulasidas said "Binu satsang viveka nahin Rama kripa binu satsang naahi....." With this firm faith, our journey started in 1981. Through the last 3 decades it has spread its wings across the world. Param Pujya Gurudev who has not only championed learning of a variety of scriptures but have inspired to live that knowledge. One who has firmly advocated that the knowledge has to transpire into living. Gurudev talks the walk. His teachings are through his living. The talks and writings are merely a reflection of the living. A role model and inspiration who magnetically attracts all who come across by his expression of love. Once experienced it is yearned for? This website is an expression of such love. An open invitation to all to experience this. 


Our Satsang started 35 years ago and over the last decade has grown into a truly global Satsang. Please write to us at Jivanmuktas.global@gmail.com

Param Pujya Guruji says actions need to follow knowledge. suna-mana-KIYA-toh jana. The emphasis is on "KIYA" (ACTION)!

Vivekachoodamani says increasing the desire to do good to others is the only way to liberation.

Guru Seva for a week a year provides the opportunity to do good to others. At just 2% of the year we can start a new habit.
This new habit will help achieve all the Satsang goals across Nivritti, Gita Distribution and Workshops. Let us do it.

string-array.name: faq
string-array.item: 3. There are already many resident volunteers. Are visiting volunteers really needed?
5. I would have loved to go to Nivritti but I have volunteered for Gita Distribution /​ ​workshops.
10. Are there any list of instructions given to volunteers before they reach Gurukula?

string-array.name: faqans
string-array.item: The minimum timespan is seven days including travel time. You can volunteer for moreif you wish.

You do. Travel cost to Nivritti Gurukul one way from various points given below:
 ● Mangalore airport INR 1800 (at times parking charges needs to be pe paid extra)
 ● Mangalore Railway station INR 1800
 ● Udupi Railway station INR [500]
 There is no other cost to be incurred by you since stay and food is at Nivritti.

There are at least five visiting volunteers required every day of the week, in addition to the resident volunteers. Reduction to these numbers results in untoward pressure on Param Pujya Guruji, which we all want to avoid. Param Pujya Guruji, is there for 12 hours a day and seven days a week – no break!! He takes three hours of satsangh plus also academic/music sessions for students. Surely none of us would want him to take such load and hence visiting volunteers are absolutely required.

This rarely happens when there are late additions to volunteers exceeding daily requirements. Generally, in most other parts of the year the numbers have remained below optimal requirement of five per day. This means there is added pressure on Param Pujya Guruji and the few resident volunteers.\n Every week a list is published in the Good News mail with number of volunteers required from Jan 1 to May 30 to make up the five every day. You will see from that list that many days there are zero volunteers!!

Param Pujya Guruji has advised that Nivritti takes priority in terms of Guru Seva during the current year. If you can do Gita Distribution / workshops and Nivritti; good! Else prioritise seva at Nivritti.

Teaching is the primary job so at any given time we do need three of the five volunteers who can do some degree of teaching. Having said that if you cannot teach at all then there are other jobs that can be done like teaching musical instruments, bhajans, routine admin jobs of minding the store supplies, Library management, looking after the girls (if you are lady), serving the food, getting ready for aarti, saying grace etc – all small jobs individually but these add up.

The subjects are very simple and the material is made available to you in advance of your visits. The technical subjects like accountancy and economics can be taught only by certain people with prior knowledge but certainly history, sociology and English can be taught by almost anyone who is willing to prepare a little bit.
There are no issues – perhaps minor inconvenience for some. If you can adjust to Indian toilets and sleeping with beds on the floor, then the infrastructure is excellent.
Given the location and conditions, only children above the age of 15 are encouraged to be brought along to the Gurukul. If you have smaller children then volunteer for offsite seva.
Yes….there is an instruction manual circulated to all visiting volunteers
Immediately once you mail/whatsapp your dates/confirm on phone

resources.string:
Charansparsh to all those who have volunteered and will be volunteering for NG-Harikhandige.
 A​.​ ​Pointers​ ​for​ ​Visiting​ ​volunteers​ ​before​ ​reaching​ ​Harikhandige
 1. Please fill up the Volunteer​ ​Availability​ ​Forms​ ​,​ ​Volunteer​ ​-​ ​Seva​ ​Form
 2. The date in volunteer availability form is in the MM/DD/YYYY​ format.
 3. Name of the visiting volunteer has to be same on both the forms.
 4. If volunteers go as couple, separate forms need to be filled for each husband and wife.
 5. If you are a repeat volunteer fill in only the Volunteer Availability Form.
 6. Kindly update your travel details to Mata Janaki ji - janaki.shrikanth16@gmail.com / Mata Anuranjani ji - anuranjaninagar@gmail.com to enable better allocation of tasks at Nivrutti as it helps to understand what is the exact time of your arrival at Nivrutti.

 *****************************************************************

 B.​ ​Travel​ ​&​ ​Other​ ​Vital​ ​details
 1. How​ ​do​ ​I​ ​reach​ ​Harikhandige​ ​(HK)?
 a. You can come by train to Udupi or Mangalore or flights are only to Mangalore.
 b. Bus route from Udupi - available upon request.
 c. For any queries on transport, from udupi / Mangalore, please contact Yogeshji (91-78997 79976) / Anuradhaji (91-9740200446). BEST​ ​OPTION
 a. Call Rajendra (9480267029) to arrange for transport to & fro from Udupi / Mangalore to HK.
 Distance Mangalore to Udupi - 55kms / Udupi to HK - 23 kms

 *****************************************************************

 C.​ ​Seva​ ​at​ ​Harikhandige Academics 
 1. Please get printouts of lecture material as well as USB with soft copies for the areas that you have been allocated.
 2. The students in Nivritti Gurukul are enrolled in Annamalai University for BA(Sociology/History/Economics) and B.Com. The volunteers are expected to teach from the material given to the students from the university.
 3. Other tasks that may be given include content creation - notes, tests, etc. Some​ ​Key​ ​Points​ ​to​ ​be​ ​noted​ ​as​ ​you​ ​take​ ​the​ ​Lectures
 1. Start the class by Chanting OM 3 times .
 2. Ask the students to read the chapter before next day's lecture.
 3. Student's English needs a lot of improvement (most of them are from Hindi medium) so please use simple words .
 4. At the end of the class help them to build their vocabulary by asking meaning of difficult word that were there in the chapter.
 5. Make the class interactive, by asking them question or creating an activity for the students to participate
 6. Please follow the schedule given to you and complete the chapter in the allotted time.
 7. Please update the Google form and register (physical) to indicate what portions you have completed with the students.
 Volunteers​ ​instructions​ ​at​ ​NG Must​ ​Do
 1. Participate in all three Satsanghs of Param Pujyas Gurujis during the day without fail.
 2. Be on time for aarti’s, Satsanghs, Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. 3. Consume food / drink, other than that served in Nivritti Gurukul (NG), in the office room.
 4. Do not change any NG schedule or activity. Do as instructed. No Man Maani​ ​–​ ​only​ ​Guru​ ​ki​ ​Maani!
 5. Teach only those topics allotted to you using material given to you. No changes are allowed.
 6. Clean as you Go – Do not leave work for others to do after you. Eg roll up your own bed, clean your own tea cups, drop your own litter in the bin etc Guidance
 1. Avoid any physical contact with students of opposite sex (eg patting, touching their head)
 2. Please complete the feedback form given to you and hand over to the NG volunteer.
 3. Please provide full information as required to HoDs of all that you have covered
 4. Ensure safety of students when you are accompanying them in and around the campus.
 5. Use mobile in designated places (outside the academic bloc and not in presence of students)
 6. Restrain from using NG Wi-Fi for non Gurukul purposes.Please understand that there is no WiFi for visiting volunteers - those who would like Wifi should bring their own Airtel dongles.
 7. Male volunteers entry restricted in the academic block from 09:45 pm to 08:00 am.
 8. Be prepared to carry out any adhoc urgent requirements on the campus
 9. Avoid direct contact with students (for eg – sharing of photos / messages with students).
 10.At arathi times, all volunteers to remain at the rear (and not on stage or in the front).

 *****************************************************************​

 D.Persona​l​ ​effects
 1. Indian rupees for transportation and local spends (NO MORE THAN INR 10k)
 2. Mosquito repellents
 3. Any special food / medicines stock as required. Please note basic medicines will be available on premises but if you require anything specific such as lip balms, or any special pain balm please get it as part of your personal effects.
 4. Flash light
 5. Bath soap -Please take a liquid soap (as there is no place to keep your soap bar)
 6. Plastic bags to take clothes to bath area, and to bring back wet clothes
 7. Thin bath towel
 8. Cap
 9. Pillow cover and a couple of thin bedsheets - These are provided, but if you prefer personal ones, please pack these.
 10.Notebook/diary & pen
 11.Small water bottle
 12.Avoid jewellery/ expensive things.
 13.Extra pairs of clothes- Please bring enough clothes, so you can avoid washing here - due to water scarcity- (please note aug & sept are rainy months). For those coming for more than a week, please bring washing powder and soap for washing.
 14.A pair of comfortable slippers & shoes (please note aug & sept are rainy months)- Washable (hawai) slippers is a must - not an option.
 15.A light shawl / cover - Winter months can be slightly chilly in the morning.
 16.Moisturiser
 17.Umbrella / Rain coat (please​ ​note​ ​aug​ ​&​ ​sept​ ​are​ ​rainy​ ​months).
 18.Hand Sanitizer
 19.Photo ID (pan card/passport)
 20.Dress code
 a. Men - kurta/pyjama or Pant/shirt
 b. Women - salwar kameez dupatta / saree - no low back / neck
 21.Laptop for all presentations / work on-site
 22.Mobile and or laptop charger
 23.Airtel dongle if you can lay your hands on one , or an Airtel connection on your phone - that’s what works here.

 *****************************************************************

 Important​ ​ ​Additional​ ​Guidelines​ ​- 1. Mobiles to be switched off / Silent inside the NG building.​ ​All​ ​calls​ ​to​ ​be​ ​taken​ ​outside​ ​the​ ​building
 2. All photography / Videography is strictly prohibited in the​ ​campus.
 3. Volunteers are strictly prohibited from interacting with​ ​the​ ​students​ ​one​ ​on​ ​one
 4. Volunteers are refrained from giving counselling / guidance​ ​to​ ​the​ ​students.
 5. All Professors must update the register on a daily basis.
